block.p: Tama Beth Ryder, the daughter of Eleanor Ryder and Dr. Willet Ryder of Patchogue, N.Y., was married yesterday to Johan Nils Herrlin, a son of Gunilla and Kjell Herrlin of London. Louis Manter, a justice of the peace, officiated at the Pomegranate Inn in Portland, Me.

Tama Beth Ryder, the daughter of Eleanor Ryder and Dr. Willet Ryder of Patchogue, N.Y., was married yesterday to Johan Nils Herrlin, a son of Gunilla and Kjell Herrlin of London. Louis Manter, a justice of the peace, officiated at the Pomegranate Inn in Portland, Me.
The couple graduated from Boston University.

Ms. Ryder, 25, is keeping her name. She is a general assignment reporter for the 11 p.m. news on WLNY-TV, in Melville, N.Y. She received a master's degree in government from Harvard. Her father is a professor of art education at York College of the City University of New York in Jamaica, Queens; he is an author, a watercolorist and a wood sculptor. Her mother teaches the fourth grade at Medford Elementary School in Patchogue.

Mr. Herrlin, 26, is a computer analyst in Boston with the Massachusetts Water Resources Authority. This month, he is to receive a master's degree in environmental remote sensing and geographic information systems from Boston University. His father owns two financial services companies, Scandinavian Finance in London and Altas Trust in Zurich.
